term.title: interfacial adhesion

item.text: Adhesion in which interfaces between phases or components are maintained by intermolecular forces, chain entanglements, or both, across the interfaces.

notes.item: Interfacial adhesion is also referred to as tack.

Adhesive strength (recommended symbol: Fa, unit: N m-2) is the force required to separate one condensed phase domain from another at the interface between the two phase domains divided by the area of the interface.
Interfacial tension (recommended symbol: γ, unit: N m-1, J m-2) is the change in Gibbs energy per unit change in interfacial area for substances in physical contact.
Use of the term interfacial energy for interfacial tension is not recommended.

sources.item: PAC, 2004, 76, 1985. 'Definition of terms related to polymer blends, composites, and multiphase polymeric materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2004)' on page 1992 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200476111985)
